node.title: Victoria's 2022 election is Labor's to lose, but the 'red wall' in Melbourne's west is changing
node.alt: Simon Corcoran smiles as he sits in grassy parkland in a t-shirt.
node.description: For years, Labor has been able to rely on a swag of votes through Melbourne's west. But shifting boundaries and changing demographics suggest rusted-on Labor backers may have an appetite for fresh political voices to champion their communities.
node.content:
["Simon Corcoran's father drove a Ford, so he did too.", "His dad voted Labor, so he followed suit.", "The primary school teacher thinks the Andrews government deserves another go, but he wants his area to have better local representation.", "\"I'd love to vote for someone else in my area because I feel like, as a safe seat, not all that much happens,'' Mr Corcoran told the ABC at his Point Cook home.", "His suburb is part of Wyndham, one of the fastest-growing local government areas in the nation, an area that also includes Werribee and Tarneit.", "It was hit hard by the pandemic and has been safe Labor territory for generations.", "A year out\u00a0from the state election, polling shows that Premier Daniel Andrews is on track to be returned for a third term.", "", "
State political reporter Bridget Rollason breaks down the seats that could decide the next election.
", "However, despite a commanding lead in the published and internal polls, Labor has some significant challenges, including a budget deep in the red and some ugly community anger.", "In the safe Labor seats in the outer suburbs, particularly the west, voters are turning off the government.", "But they aren't necessarily turning to Matthew Guy's Coalition.", "Clive Palmer's United Australia Party looks to be\u00a0picking up votes, as are other minor parties, in a sign of voter dissatisfaction with governments both on Spring Street and in Canberra.", "Pollsters and strategists are also seeing the mood for independents to do well, especially in the western suburbs.", "In 2018, independent doctor Joe Garra won nearly 20 per cent of the vote in Werribee against Treasurer Tim Pallas \u2014 that's more votes than the Liberals.", "A new seat of Point Cook has now been established nearby.", "", "
The new Victorian state electorate of Point Cook sits within Labor's historically safe heartland in Melbourne's west.(ABC News: Paul Sellenger)
", "Dr Garra hasn't decided to run, or which he seat he would contest, but it certainly is on the minds of some ALP types.", "Wyndham was smashed by COVID-19,\u00a0and Dr Garra was on the frontline.", "He was no shrinking violet when it came to highlighting government mismanagement and believes there is frustration toward Premier Andrews, but he doesn't know how that will translate at the ballot box.", "\"They're not really fascinated with the Liberals,\" he said.", "\"They're not saying, 'I'm going to vote Liberal.\u00a0We want Matthew Guy to be our Premier'.\u00a0They are sort of saying, 'I don't like Dan'.\u00a0I think they're a bit unsure where to [put their] vote.\"", "", "
Joe Garra has a high profile his local community, where he has worked as a doctor for many years.(ABC News: Kristian Silva)
", "Polling company RedBridge's Simon Welsh said the desire for local independents in Labor's traditional \"red wall\" of Melbourne's west had come through strongly in the past year, and could be divided into two camps.", "\"We're seeing it play out amongst a group that have been impacted by lockdowns and those sorts of policies,\" he said.", "\"But, also, there's another cohort, which is folk [who]\u00a0have moved out into the west of Melbourne in the last sort of five, 10 years or so.", "While it may be a headache for Labor, it's not good news for the opposition.", "Mr Welsh said that, in the eastern side of Melbourne, votes coming off the Liberal pile were moving to \"largely the uncertain pile, but also some of those minor parties as well\".", "
Infrastructure lagging behind a booming population
", "Back in Point Cook, Mr Corcoran said he didn't have \"any faith in the Liberal opposition\".", "\"I'd love any strong independent representing our area. But, having said that, I do like what the Labor government have done at the moment, so it's a bit of a double-edged sword.\"", "", "
Sitting roughly 25 kilometres south-west of the CBD, Point Cook has become one of the fastest-growing Melbourne communities.(ABC News)
", "Across the west, there is a feeling of political neglect from all levels of government.", "Mr Corcoran said that, despite some recent improvements, the long-running story was one of infrastructure failing to keep up with population growth.", "\"I've been here for 10 years and we had two roads to get in and out, and the traffic was horrific,\" he said.", "The Premier denies his government has taken the west for granted.", "In an interview with the ABC, he rattled off a list of funding and projects in the area, among it 22 new schools and $1.5 billion in road upgrades.", "\"We've invested [strongly] in the west, but we know there's more to be done there,\" Mr Andrews\u00a0said.", "\"I have never taken any Victorian for granted [nor] their votes, their support, the mandate to keep doing what we've been doing.\"", "
Premier who\u00a0won't be 'distracted' by noise
", "Despite this, the perception on the ground is that the area could do better\u00a0and, in elections, that is what matters.", "To many people it may seem remarkable that Andrews sits in such a commanding position.", "", "
Despite pandemic challenges and scandals besetting Labor, Daniel Andrews commands a healthy lead over the opposition.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "His party and members of his government are being run through the wringer at the state's anti-corruption commission.\u00a0He presided over one of the world's longest lockdowns and Victoria has suffered more COVID-19 chaos than anywhere else in Australia.", "However,\u00a0deaths have been relatively low on a global scale. Mistakes have been made, but right now voters aren't turning off Labor in droves.", "The recent management of the pandemic bill has been a major misstep\u00a0of this term and has been seen by some to reek of arrogance, a view shared by even some Labor insiders.", "Only dealing with three crossbenchers has cost the government, and the longer the issue has dragged on, the more time it has allowed for protesters and misinformation to grow.", "Rallies in the street against his government, and him personally, have been loud, and at times nasty, vile and threatening, but have also contained thousands of people who aren't engaged in dark conspiracy theories.", "", "
Protesters have been making noise in Melbourne's CBD, but the Premier says the state's vaccination rate demonstrates they are in the minority.(Facebook)
", "\"I'm not distracted by a small number of people who act in that way,\" Mr Andrews said.", "\"I acknowledge that there are people who have a different view to me, and if they're protesting peacefully, well that's fine.", "\"That's an important part of our democratic system. I've defended the right to do that all of my adult life. But if it's not peaceful, it's not protest.\"", "Mr Andrews denies Victoria is divided, reasoning that with nine in 10 Victorians over 12 years of age double-vaccinated, the majority understand the pandemic and what needs to be done to tackle it.", "
Labor voters are weighing up the power of their ballot
", "Kellie and Brendan Jackson in Point Cook describe themselves as traditional Labor voters but are considering voting elsewhere if it can improve services in their community.", "", "
Brendan and Kellie Jackson are raising their son, Zane, in Labor heartland at Point Cook.(ABC News: Michael Barnett)
", "Mr Jackson said he felt that Labor did the \"bare minimum\" to keep his safe seat onside and pondered how casting a different vote might change things.", "\"I wonder how much more we'd get if we were a swinging seat or we were on the margins,\" he said.", "But both he and his wife said they were unlikely to vote for the Coalition, and Ms Jackson dismissed the Palmer United Party as \"full of hot air\".", "\"You need extremes to get you back to that middle I think,\" she said.", "\"Everyone's allowed to have their view, I suppose, but it shows you what not to vote for in a way.\"", "Both of them said they would be watching carefully to see who put their hand up for their seat and assessing the candidates on their merits.", "
An opposition with its eyes on the prize declares days of negativity are 'over'
", "A year is a long time in politics, and there is time for the opposition to build its case before the November 2022 election.", "It must win 18 seats to form government. It needs to regain its once-safe seats in the eastern suburbs as a starting point. It would be a Herculean effort, but there are plenty of issues to campaign on.", "", "
Matthew Guy says he'll approach the next election differently, after leading the Liberals to a crushing 2018 defeat.(AAP: James Ross)
", "Labor and the pandemic have plunged the budget deep into the red. In an interview with the ABC, Mr Guy said the key to managing the budget without slashing services was to ensure that money was well spent, and that Victorians were getting value for money.", "\"We don't need to go and reduce public sector like we did in the '90s,\" he said.", "\"But we need to make sure that we're getting good results for Victorians, both in the health sector, in infrastructure spending. When you budget, you don't let a blowout.\"", "However, every time the party seems to making ground, it shoots itself in the foot: Kew MP Tim Smith's drunken crash is the opposition's latest embarrassment.", "", "
Tim Smith created days of negative headlines for the opposition as he weighed up recontesting his seat of Kew.(ABC News: Richard Willingham)
", "A lack of depth in the party room also makes the job for Mr Guy tough,\u00a0and the federal election next year will shape the state poll, sucking up\u00a0the political oxygen at the start of 2022.", "Should\u00a0Scott Morrison be\u00a0returned to the Lodge, the task for Victorian Coalition will be even harder.", "If the PM remains in office, it gives the Premier someone to rail against, especially in a state where the Prime Minister remains on the nose.", "Still, Mr Guy says he has learnt from the 2018 annihilation.", "The Bulleen MP is now much calmer and says the Coalition's agenda will be more positive.", "\"I'm not interested in talking about my opponent or focusing on him personally. That's not what Victorians want from us,\" he said.", "\"They want us to be an opposition focused on Victoria, Victorians and our future.", "\"The days of Australians just picking up politicians on negativity is over.\"", "It's a sentiment coming loud and clear from voters like the Jackson family, who want politicians to offer concrete policies and a plan for their children's futures.", "\"Don't govern for the now, govern for the future. Govern so that, in 10 years' time, the infrastructure's there, the jobs are there,'' Mr Jackson said."]
